story.title: Founded With a Profound Vision
story.p1: In 2006, Moody and Esther Lee founded Weihai Zhongshi International School (also known locally as Weihai Zhongshi Foreign School, or WZFS) with a bold vision: to cultivate servant leaders who will make a lasting, positive impact on the world.
story.p2: The name "Zhongshi" (中世) reflects our mission — "From China to the World." We nurture global citizens with strong values, academic excellence, and a deep commitment to serving others. Our students — whom we lovingly call BoBae (보배), the Korean word for "precious one" — are at the heart of everything we do.

welcome.title: Welcome from the President
welcome.p1: Welcome to Weihai Zhongshi International School — known as both WZIS and WZFS (Weihai Zhongshi Foreign School). Both names refer to the same school and community; you may see either used by staff, families, and alumni. Our competitive athletics program operates as the Zhongshi Sports Academy (ZSA). The name 'Zhongshi' reflects our mission, derived from the Chinese phrase meaning 'From China to the World.'
welcome.p2: Since our founding in 2006, we have been committed to this vision: preparing our students to step out into the world as servant leaders.
welcome.p3: At WZIS, a servant leader is someone who uses their talents and abilities to benefit others. Our goal is to equip students with both the academic skills and the character needed to excel wherever they go. Central to this mission is our comprehensive character development program, which is built around five core values: respect, wisdom, self-expression, responsibility, and holistic education.
welcome.p4: Our students are at the heart of everything we do. They are so important to us that we affectionately refer to them as 'BoBae's' (pronounced Boh-Bae), a Korean word meaning 'precious one.' This reflects our deep commitment to nurturing and valuing each student as a unique and precious individual.
welcome.p5: We offer a robust international curriculum alongside a wide range of extracurricular activities. We believe that every BoBae matters, and we are committed to providing opportunities for all who enroll. With our emphasis on small class sizes and a close-knit, supportive community, we ensure that each BoBae feels valued and encouraged to achieve their best.

bobae.title: The BoBae Culture
bobae.description: At WZIS, students are affectionately referred to as 'BoBae' (보배), a Korean term meaning 'precious one.' This term reflects how deeply we value each member of our school community, seeing each individual not just as a student, but as a cherished part of the WZIS family. Our school mascot, the Eagle, represents the strength, vision, and soaring ambition we cultivate in every BoBae.

academics_page.intro: WZIS is proud to offer the Cambridge International curriculum, one of the world's most respected educational frameworks. Our program spans from Primary through A-Levels, providing a seamless and rigorous academic journey. We are accredited by WASC and ACSI, and serve as an official SAT Test Center.
